t: Come,*pn let us sing for joy to the Lord;*s let*ld us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.
Let*ln us come before him with thanksgiving and*ld extol him with music and song.
For*pn the Lord*s is the great God, the*ld great King above all gods.
In*ln his hand are the depths of the earth, and*ld the mountain peaks belong to him.
The*ln sea is his, for he made it, and*ld his hands formed the dry land.
Come,*pn let us bow down in worship, let*ld us kneel before the Lord*s our Maker;
for*ln he is our God and*ld we are the people of his pasture, the*ld flock under his care. Today,*pn if only you would hear his voice,
“Do*ln not harden your hearts as you did at Meribah, as*ld you did that day at Massah in the wilderness,
where*ln your ancestors tested me; they*ld tried me, though they had seen what I did.
For*ln forty years I was angry with that generation; I*ld said, ‘They are a people whose hearts go astray, and*ld they have not known my ways.’
So*ln I declared on oath in my anger, ‘They*ld shall never enter my rest.’ ”
